New Records: India recorded the highest total at this venue so far with 196 for five
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli (37 off 28) found much-needed rhythm
Shivam Dube (34 off 24) and Hardik (50 not out off 27) pushed India to 196 for five
Kuldeep Yadav foxed Bangladesh batters with his guile
Bangladesh could never really challenge India in the steep run-chase and ended up with 146/8 in 20 overs
Najmul Shanto (40 off 32) played some attacking shots including two sixes over fine leg off Hardik
Pre-Game Insights: Skipper Rohit Sharma (23 off 11) was happy to lose the toss at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium and alongside Kohli (37 off 28), was able to play his shots from the get go unlike the earlier games
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya produced an all-round show while Kuldeep Yadav foxed Bangladesh batters with his guile as India all but assured themselves of a semifinals berth through a dominant 50-run victory in their second Super 8 game of the T20 World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: India will meet their match in Australia, the two unbeaten teams so far, in their final Super 8 fixture in St Lucia on Monday
Kuldeep (3/19), who got his opportunity in the Caribbean leg of the competition, made the Bangladesh batters look clueless with the effective use of googly and stock ball
